data.title: French elite loses faith in nation’s fabled state schools
data.meta_description: The state education system, long held up as the cornerstone of French egalitarian aspiration, is being shunned by the upper-middle classes.In a reversal of m
data.text:
The state education system, long held up as the cornerstone of French egalitarian aspiration, is being shunned by the upper-middle classes.

In a reversal of more than a hundred years of history and tradition they are instead sending their children to private schools.

The trend has emerged after the government published a Social Position Index, which classifies schools according to a range of factors including the income and qualifications of pupils’ parents, the size of their home and access to the internet and to sporting and cultural activities.

The rankings showed that among the top 10 per cent of secondary schools in terms of the index most are private. Among the bottom 10 per cent only a few are private.
